intro: Pentanema nematolepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pentanema, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or heathland environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
